intro: Verbascum styriacum, commonly known as the Styrian mullein, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are broad and fuzzy, and the plant is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant.
